title: Chino Valley Ranchers Pasture Raised Eggs Featured in Eggs-in-a-Hole Recipe
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
Chino Valley Ranchers organic, pasture raised eggs were recently featured in an Instagram post by Social Media Influencer Carly Schwartzbach on her profile @everything_but_the_bagel which has over 27,000 followers.

In the post, Carly writes, “There is nothing better than #chinovalleyranchers eggs that come from pasture raised hens who are free to roam in wide-open fields!” The eggs-in-a-hole recipe calls for Chino Valley Ranchers pasture raised eggs, thick cut toasted bread, truffle butter, bacon, and chives. 

Speaking about the Instagram post, Vice President of Chino Valley Ranchers Chris Nichols says, “Egg-in-a-hole recipes are a fun way to enjoy eggs for breakfast — or lunch or dinner. I love the simplicity of Carly’s recipe and look forward to trying it at home with Chino Valley Ranchers pasture raised eggs.”

Chino Valley Ranchers pasture-raised chickens receive 108 square feet of land per hen and are free to roam, forage for bugs, bathe in the dust, bask in the sunshine and relax in the shade. Chino Valley Ranchers’ pasture-raised eggs are American Humane Certified and production practices adhere to strict regulations.

On her Instagram post, Carly Schwartzbach shares niche food products and recipes for bowls, appetizers, toast and more. For the full Instagram post, visit https://www.instagram.com/p/B55sZR_A0Sn/.
